game_description: Jurassic World Aftermath Collection is a suspenseful, survival VR adventure. Crash-landing on Isla Nublar after the fall of Jurassic World, you find yourself trapped in a research facility when your mission to recover valuable information goes disastrously wrong. Your only hope of escape is to retrieve the confidential information while trying to avoid three deadly Velociraptors. To survive, you’ll need to explore, solve puzzles, and find ways to distract and hide from the ferocious Velociraptors that stalk your every move. Features: - Thrilling gameplay that combines strategy, skill and non-stop thrills. - Action-packed dinosaur encounters that require quick-thinking, skill, and a little bit of luck to survive. - Useful tools and devices to solve puzzles and discover secrets. - Stylized graphic design that comes to life in VR.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Spain)
review_1: Solid game. Part 2 is way better than part 1, but near the end gets kinda of frustrating. The pteranodons were a pain. Loved everything else. Definitely worth it, but the developers NEED to add a scene select feature once completed so we can play certain parts again without having to play the entire story. You will get more and better reviews if you give it replay value. EDIT: It's been over a year now. Any word on a possible update for splitting the chapters up into smaller sections so we can choose to replay certain scenes from the main menu?

review_5: Just played through the game for the second time (second-and-a-half time, actually, since I played through the first chapter before the second came out and then started over once it did), and I have to say the game definitely holds up! Graphics are stylized of course, but because the game isn't going for photorealism, it's able to give you some pleasing light and shadow effects that really enhance the atmospheric quality of the environment as you make your way through the deserted facility in your attempt to survive and escape the island. As an added bonus, if you elect not to use the crouch button you'll get a fair amount of exercise getting down to duck behind cover, crawl through vents, or to just make yourself as inconspicuous as possible when the raptors are hunting you (and then scurrying to your feet so you can sprint at full speed when they find you). It's not one of those games that leaves you exhausted and drenched in sweat by the time you're done, but I'm sure I burned a few calories playing it.
